channel.title: Sleeping
channel.description:
Hello,
I am in the middle of tinkering with the sleeping process, where is the amount of fatigue gained per monster declared?
Thanks

item.title: Sleeping
item.dc:creator: @Vibes Vibes
item.description:
@Vibes wrote:

thank you sir Simple enough

Read full topic

item.title: Sleeping
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

You can look up moparclassic (Idk if I pushed it or not to pre beta) so might be on mine… there is a formula for it and we learned that there is some hack shit done by the client. I might have provided some //comments… You can find it in player class. It was near perfect until we changed it around so it might be all fucked.

Read full topic

item.title: Sleeping
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote=“imthenull, post:20, topic:435471”][quote author=amfg link=topic=538192.msg3937137#msg3937137 date=1331132323]

RuneScape Classic Wiki

Fatigue

Fatigue is a stat in RuneScape Classic which affects your abilities to gain experience. When your fatigue reaches 100%, you no longer gain experience from training in Classic. To restore your fatigue, one must rest. Players can rest on a bed, Crude...


[/quote]

Great find![/quote]Useless find. Fatigue rate uses a formula.

Read full topic

item.title: Sleeping
item.dc:creator: @waj waj
item.description:
@waj wrote:

freaky5000:

Basically, on controlled mode it’s giving 4% fatigue, I havn’t a clue where to look. Others are giving either 1 or 2%

latifundio basically spoon fed you and you’re still confused?

Read full topic

item.title: Sleeping
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

[quote=“Outspoken, post:2, topic:435484”][quote author=-Nothing link=topic=538192.msg3937067#msg3937067 date=1331118895]

Hello,

Google it.

Fuck off.

I doubt there would be decent documentation on the subject…

I know that the amount of fatigue can differ for each skill, but is it different for each Npc? Also, in RSCD everything increments fatigue by 1%… which obviously is incorrect

I bet there is. I actually found one months ago but I cannot remember it anymore. So he really wants it he will either google for it for hours, or log into RSC and test shit out.
And no it’s not different for each npc.
[/quote]

Completely wrong. Each NPC gives a different amount of fatigue based on how much EXP they give. Stop giving false information.

Why the fuck do you think doing this “fatigue trick” wont work on all NPCs?

Get a clue…[/quote]
You failed to see what I said(as usual)…I never claimed that it isn’t based on the experience they gave, I meant that there aren’t any special npcs that give more fatigue.

Read full topic

item.title: Sleeping
item.dc:creator: @latifundio latifundio
item.description:
@latifundio wrote:

set it up like rsca?

public void incExp(int i, int amount, boolean useFatigue, boolean combat) { if (isPMod()) return; if (useFatigue) { if (fatigue >= 100) { actionSender .sendMessage("@gre@You are too tired to gain experience, get some rest!"); return; } if (fatigue >= 96) { actionSender .sendMessage("@gre@You start to feel tired, maybe you should rest soon."); } if (i >= 3 && useFatigue) { fatigue++; actionSender.sendFatigue(); } }

Read full topic
